title: Home - Universitywide COVID-19 Information
cleaned_text: coverings are not required at the university but are welcomed. Learn more about them in [clinical settings.](https://coronavirus.rutgers.edu/updated-spring-2023-health-and-safety-protocols-for-clinical-settings/) Follow the CDC's [Quarantine and Isolation Calculator](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/your-health/isolation.html) for COVID infection and exposure guidance. The university's COVID testing program has ended. All COVID test centers are closed. Reporting of positive test results is no longer required. Vaccinations COVID-19 vaccines are required of students and employees unless granted a medical or religious exemption by the university. Booster doses are no longer required except for " [Covered Individuals](https://policies.rutgers.edu/10031-currentpdf)." Upload proof of vaccination and boosters (if required) to the vaccine portals. [Student vaccine portal ](https://wayf.incommonfederation.org/DS/WAYF/?entityID=https%3A%2F%2Fsso.medicatconnect.com%2Fshibboleth&return=https%3A%2F%2Frutgers.medicatconnect.com%2FShibboleth.sso%2FLogin%3FSAMLDS%3D1%26target%3Dss%253Amem%253A06e20874fd915117c4c192a11d1ad8d525267db88895e6bfd00eaa82f6f4b747) [Faculty and Staff vaccine portal](https://rtr.ipo.rutgers.edu/vaccines/) Read the [university policy](https://policies.rutgers.edu/60-1-36-currentpdf) that addresses vaccination requirements for contractors, guest lecturers, and others. Health & Safety Find [student health centers](https://coronavirus.rutgers.edu/health-and-safety/) information; support and guidance services at [CAPS](http://health.rutgers.edu/medical-counseling-services/counseling) or [UBHC](https://ubhc.rutgers.edu). [ScarletWell ](https://newbrunswick.rutgers.edu/scarletwell)is a public health and prevention-focused approach to mental health and wellness for students, faculty, and staff at Rutgers-New Brunswick. See additional [wellness programs](https://uhr.rutgers.edu/benefits/wellness-programs) for Rutgers staff and faculty. Be Prepared For resources that can answer your questions about the current semester, please visit your respective campus operating status page: Announcements May 10, 2023 [Updated Masking Requirements for Clinical Settings](https://coronavirus.rutgers.edu/updated-spring-2023-health-and-safety-protocols-for-clinical-settings/) As COVID-19 cases continue to decline, Rutgers Health is updating its masking guidelines for clinical settings. Wearing a face covering is no longer broadly required of all faculty, staff, students, and visitors in all clinical settings. May 5, 2023 [Updated Vaccine Requirements](https://coronavirus.rutgers.edu/covid-19-vaccine#updated) Review the guidance for what is required vs. recommended with respect to COVID-19 vaccination. March 17, 2023 [Updated Spring 2023 Health and Safety Protocols](https://sites.rutgers.edu/coronavirus/updated-spring-2023-health-and-safety-protocols/) The university continues to monitor the relevant health and safety data associated with COVID-19, Respiratory Syncytial Virus (RSV), and Seasonal Influenza (Flu). The current positive data reflect substantial improvement and stability and allow us to institute a relaxation in our operating protocols. COVID-19 Vaccine and Boosters: All students and employees who have not been granted a medical or religious exemption by the university continue to be required to have completed a primary series of vaccinations. Booster doses will no longer be required unless an individual falls within the definition of a "Covered Individual" set forth in [University Policy 100.3.1](https://policies.rutgers.edu/10031-currentpdf). Upload proof of vaccination and boosters (if required) to the vaccine portals. [Student vaccine portal ](https://wayf.incommonfederation.org/DS/WAYF/?entityID=https%3A%2F%2Fsso.medicatconnect.com%2Fshibboleth&return=https%3A%2F%2Frutgers.medicatconnect.com%2FShibboleth.sso%2FLogin%3FSAMLDS%3D1%26target%3Dss%253Amem%253A06e20874fd915117c4c192a11d1ad8d525267db88895e6bfd00eaa82f6f4b747) [Faculty and Staff vaccine portal](https://rtr.ipo.rutgers.edu/vaccines/) More announcements can be found on the [Communications page](https://sites.rutgers.edu/coronavirus/communications/). This website is your official source of information about the university's response to COVID-19.
